this channel is SOOO hard to read in irs: Actually I find it easier with irssi than with most, in large part due to "/lastlog" and "/scrollback"

Knowing your entire situation, I'd say that the easiest solution is to just install Ubuntu desktop. If you have SG2D still on your SD card then you can just create a directory, /boot-isos/, put the Ubuntu Desktop CD in that directory, and boot the iso with SG2D (rather than using unetbootin, which will clobber SG2D)
jocky is the name of the "restricted drivers" app, you can use "jocky-text" without X, or the normal "jockey-gtk"
